messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: I will derive this data from the following paragraph: CASE NAME: The Puzzling Park Puzzle DATE: 04/04/75 The courtroom was a ground of rigorous questioning as the trial moved forward. The prosecution called upon the officers core to the investigation to reveal their discoveries. LAW ENFORCEMENT TESTIMONY: PROSECUTOR: Please state your name and role in the investigation. WITNESS: I am Captain A. B. Anderson, the main investigator of this case. PROSECUTOR: Thank you, Captain Anderson. Can you describe the events on the afternoon the puzzle was found? WITNESS: Certainly. On the afternoon of August 8th, Officer C. D. Davis stumbled upon an odd scenario at the park and reported it. The investigation commenced immediately. PROSECUTOR: Who led the forensic examination? WITNESS: Sergeant E. F. Edwards and Technician G. H. Harrison directed the forensic analysis. PROSECUTOR: Who carried out the interrogations? WITNESS: Detectives I. J. Johnson and K. L. Lewis executed the interrogations of suspects and potential witnesses. PROSECUTOR: Thank you. No further questions. The Defense launched a detailed cross-examination of Captain Anderson regarding the investigative methods. Throughout the trial, Patrol Officer M. N. Nelson, Patrol Officer O. P. Olsen, and Patrol Officer Q. R. Ramirez were also summoned to testify.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Captain A. B. Anderson 
Officer Context: Captain Anderson is the main investigator in the Puzzling Park Puzzle case, describing the events on the afternoon the puzzle was found during the trial. 
Officer Role: Captain 

Officer Name: Officer C. D. Davis 
Officer Context: Officer Davis discovered an odd scenario at the park on the afternoon of August 8th, which initiated the investigation. 
Officer Role: Officer 

Officer Name: Sergeant E. F. Edwards 
Officer Context: Sergeant Edwards, alongside Technician G. H. Harrison, led the forensic examination related to the case. 
Officer Role: Sergeant 

Officer Name: Technician G. H. Harrison 
Officer Context: Technician Harrison worked with Sergeant E. F. Edwards on the forensic analysis concerning the odd scenario at the park. 
Officer Role: Technician 

Officer Name: Detective I. J. Johnson 
Officer Context: Detective Johnson, alongside Detective K. L. Lewis, carried out interrogations of suspects and potential witnesses to gather more information regarding the puzzle. 
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Detective K. L. Lewis 
Officer Context: Detective Lewis, along with Detective I. J. Johnson, was tasked with interrogating individuals to collect additional information about the incident. 
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Patrol Officer M. N. Nelson 
Officer Context: Patrol Officer Nelson was summoned to testify during the trial, although their specific role in the investigation was not detailed in the transcript. 
Officer Role: Patrol Officer 

Officer Name: Patrol Officer O. P. Olsen 
Officer Context: Patrol Officer Olsen was also called to testify during the trial, although their specific role in the investigation was not detailed in the transcript. 
Officer Role: Patrol Officer 

Officer Name: Patrol Officer Q. R. Ramirez 
Officer Context: Patrol Officer Ramirez was brought to testify during the trial, although their specific role in the investigation was not detailed in the transcript. 
Officer Role: Patrol Officer
